{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Buffalo |model=WLI-H4-D1300 |revision= |upc=747464125145 |asin=B0084JFLTE |price=180 |est_release_date=05/14/2012 |fcc_date=04/20/2012 |is_manuf= |manuf=Arcadyan |manuf_model=WA9116B |manuf_rev=AC33 |availability=now |type=bridge |fcc_id=FDI-09101695-0 |ic_id=6102A-041 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=3 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4706 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Samsung |fla1_model=K9F1G08U0D-SCB0 |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model=EM68B16CWQD-25H |ram1_num=2 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Arcadyan WN8833B-AC |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (oversized) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module=Arcadyan WN8833B-GN |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4331 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model=BCM53125 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=10:6F:3F |oui_eth=10:6F:3F }} {{TagLine|AC1300/N450 Gigabit Dual Band Media Bridge}} :[http://www.buffalotech.com/products/wireless/client-adapters/airstation-ac1300-n450-4-port-gigabit-dual-band-wireless-ethernet-bridge-wli-h4-d1300/ Product page] {{â€¢}} [http://www.buffalotech.com/products/wireless/client-adapters/airstation-ac1300-n450-4-port-gigabit-dual-band-wireless-ethernet-bridge-wli-h4-d1300/ Datasheet]
This device is [[Broadcom]] based (OEM: [[Arcadyan]]) {{See also|Buffalo WZR-D1800H}}
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/31754-draft-80211ac-revealed-buffalo-wzr-d1800h-airstation-reviewed-part-1 Review on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :internal shot of the WLI-H4-D1300 included; 10:6F:3F OUI is likely :"P/N: 141883320008J" is silkscreened on the BCM4360 wireless module.
The BCM4360 wireless module uses 3x [[Skyworks]] (SiGe) SE5003L :(5 GHz, 23dBm Power Amp w/ Power Detector). The BCM4331 wireless module uses 3x [[Skyworks]] (SiGe) SE2594L :(Dual Band 802.11a/b/g/n Wireless LAN Front End). <!-- The Buffalo Firmware is bad. This Devices performs some thing like a MAC Address NAT substitution instead of 4 MAC WDS transport. :-( The Changes of the MAC Address is not compatible to all Network applications. For example: Connecting multiple Routers with aditional subnets will not work over this "Bridge" -->
